# async(execute:)

**Instance Method**

Requests that a block be executed on the connection’s internal scheduling context.

## Declaration

```swift
final func async(execute: @escaping () -> Void)
```

## Discussion

You should call this if you need to call any framer functions but are in another scheduling context.

## Handling Asynchronous Events

- **scheduleWakeup(wakeupTime:)**: Requests that [doc://com.apple.network/documentation/Network/NWProtocolFramerImplementation/wakeup(framer:)] be called on your protocol at a specific time in the future.
- **NWProtocolFramer.Instance.WakeupTime**: Times at which to schedule a protocol wakeup.
